nodes.text: Control Room. The main console sits in an administrative state: a compliance hold banner, a draft memo queued, and a blinking field that wants a reason phrase more than it wants the truth.
Logs are live. (pause) Printer's got paper. (pause) Tray's empty— noted now. (pause) It doesn't turn into a fight later.

Before you touch a verb—closure processing. (pause)
Don’t hand Finance a reclassification event. (pause)
I know it sounds the same. (pause)
Finance won’t hear it that way.
Put the label on it first. (pause) Do it first. (pause) Or somebody else names it after the fact. (pause) And it’ll be the worst possible name.
Standing pending. Service class pending. (pause) Queue position maintained. Processing window active.

choices.text: use: Main console — submit reclassification request
ask: What category will you accept?
ask: What counts as authority chain?
leave: Step away from the console

nodes.text: You step back. The room keeps humming like it has a union contract.
Walk away if you need to. (pause) Timestamp keeps running. (pause) Come back when you're ready. (pause) Do it on the record.
What category will you accept?

They’ll only take an existing service class. (pause)
They won’t clear an unauthorized node state. (pause)
If anything moves, it’s a reclass. (pause)
Into a licensed relationship—once eligibility’s demonstrated.
When they say “demonstrated,” (pause) they mean “asserted with attachments.” (pause) Nobody’s proving anything here. (pause) I’m saying that for the recording.
Licensed relationship is fine—keep it in “municipal infrastructure.” (pause) The second it smells like “research,” (pause) we’re donating a fiscal year (pause) to committees.
Authority chain?

Authority chain needs operator-of-record ID. (pause)
A statement: you’re at the endpoint. (pause)
A physical claim. (pause)
And counterparty acknowledgment: inside licensed relationship category.

Watch the verbs. (pause) “Acknowledgment.” “Acceptance.” (pause) Use those. (pause) “Authorization” drags in baggage. (pause) And yeah it still binds operationally. (pause) We’re not unpacking that right now.
Type anything, print before and after. Skip screenshots. (pause) They turn into opinions. (pause) In a room full of lawyers.
The console opens AUTHORITY CHAIN: “Add signatory / add attachment / echo-back text.”
On the console: “SUBMIT REQUEST — RELATIONSHIP/CLASS UPDATE (NON-LOCAL).” Fields: SUBJECT NODE, REQUESTED CATEGORY, REASON PHRASE, AUTHORITY CHAIN, ATTACHMENTS.
MTA. We’re submitting.

Keep the submission non-narrative. (pause)
Request category. (pause)
Service class basis. (pause)
Authority chain. (pause)
Do not speculate on cause. (pause)
Narrative creates jurisdiction.
And keep “authorize” out of it. (pause) That word starts a chain. (pause) It ends with duty—on paper. (pause) Then it ends with me.

Also—keep “discovery” out. (pause)
Even as a joke. (pause)
Jokes get typed up like admissions.

choices.text: use: Select category — Licensed municipal infrastructure (legacy interconnection)
use: Select category — Temporary licensed interconnection (retirement processing)
ask: Read back the hold reference
leave: Cancel and step back

nodes.text: Read back the hold reference.
MTA_NOTICE_REF: [string]. (pause) Submission log: [string]. (pause) Queue position: maintained. (pause) Processing window: active.
Print it from the tray. (pause) No photos, no retyping. (pause) Let the machine own the string.
The printer chatters. A header sheet slides into the tray.
You select the category that pretends the past was competent enough to have meant this. Legacy codes scroll like they’ve been waiting.

Category request received: licensed relationship. (pause) Service class requested: municipal infrastructure—legacy. (pause) Need a reason phrase. (pause) Need the authority chain. (pause) No narrative.

If this lands, exposure closes; accounting won’t move. (pause)
That’s the only miracle we’re funded for.
In the authority chain use “acknowledge.” (pause) Use “accept” too. (pause) Leave out “grant.” (pause) “Grant” reads like clean ownership. (pause) Nobody wants to sign that.
You choose the narrowest existing label. It feels like a lie engineered for survivability.

Good. “Temporary.” “Processing.” (pause)
Those words don’t buy us new obligations.
Also—don’t make it sound “ongoing.” (pause) Skip “keep it running.” (pause) Use “maintain continuity.”
Category’s acceptable once the reason phrase is in. (pause) And the authority chain. (pause) Send the reason phrase. (pause) Send the attachments. (pause) No narrative.

choices.text: give: Reason phrase — Retirement processing continuity; compliance hold resolution; continuous logging; operator present
give: Reason phrase — Reclassify SOL‑EARTH‑LOCAL as legacy municipal infrastructure; acknowledge/accept licensed relationship
leave: Back out to category selection
give: Reason phrase — Retirement processing continuity; compliance hold resolution; continuous logging; operator present
give: Reason phrase — Reclassify SOL‑EARTH‑LOCAL as legacy municipal infrastructure; acknowledge/accept licensed relationship
leave: Back out to category selection

nodes.text: Retirement processing continuity; compliance hold resolution; continuous logging; operator present.

Reason phrase logged. (pause)
Still need the authority chain: (pause)
operator-of-record ID (pause)
and counterparty acknowledgment (pause)
for licensed relationship classification.

That’s one sentence. Leave it as one. (pause)
Second sentence turns into a story.
Reclassify SOL‑EARTH‑LOCAL as legacy municipal infrastructure; acknowledge/accept licensed relationship.
Strip anything that smells like novelty. (pause) “Legacy” is fine—it reads like old paperwork. (pause) And cut “still.”

“Legacy municipal infrastructure” is fine in the ledger. (pause)
Just don’t make it a headline.
Reason phrase logged. (pause) Legacy municipal infrastructure framing noted. (pause) Still need authority chain. (pause) Operator-of-record ID. (pause) Counterparty acknowledgment.

choices.text: give: Add OLEA Legal as co-signer (recorded acknowledgment)
give: Submit with operator-only authority chain
persuade: Mark as municipal legacy asset under OLEA retirement authority
leave: Back out

nodes.text: Operator-of-record: on-site. Submitting under retirement processing.
I’m not telling you you can’t. (pause) I’m telling you you’ll be alone. (pause) In the record. (pause) Alone isn’t illegal. (pause) It’s just expensive.

Authority-chain incomplete.
Counterparty ack required for 'licensed' classification.
Mark it as municipal legacy asset under OLEA retirement authority. Operator-of-record present. Continuous logging. No narrative.

Requested framing recorded. (pause)
Municipal legacy service class proceeds. (pause)
Under a licensed relationship. (pause)
With a valid authority chain. (pause)
They still need counterparty acknowledgment.
They’re not refusing the outcome. (pause) They’re refusing to be first. (pause) Not first in the chain. (pause) Give them an acknowledgment. (pause) One they can actually file.
You tap OLEA Legal’s recorded line into the chain. The console prepares an echo-back statement for spoken acknowledgment.

On-screen echo-back: “OLEA Legal acknowledges submission for category update as retirement processing instrument; accepts limited-purpose licensed relationship classification for SOL‑EARTH‑LOCAL; no admission of novelty; continuous logging maintained; operator present on-site.”

OLEA Legal acknowledges the submission. (pause) Category update filed as retirement instrument. (pause) Limited purpose only. (pause) Accepts licensed relationship classification for SOL‑EARTH‑LOCAL. (pause) Under municipal legacy infrastructure service class. (pause) No admission of novelty. (pause) Continuous logging maintained. (pause) Operator present on-site.
When that echo-back screen posts (pause) print it (pause) Otherwise you'll get accused (pause) of paraphrasing the legal part.

Acknowledgment received.
Send attachments and operator-of-record ID.

choices.text: show: Attach memo draft and hold reference printout
show: Attach full retirement packet (binder scan)
ask: Confirm service class eligibility
leave: Cancel

nodes.text: Memo and notice reference attached.
Attachments received. (pause) Indicator’s a conditional pass—pending operator-of-record identification.

Title it “retirement processing.” (pause)
Keep “renegotiation” out. Words get searched.
Full retirement packet attached.
Attachments received. Standing indicator: conditional pass—pending operator-of-record ID.
Confirm service class eligibility.

Eligibility: municipal legacy infrastructure service class is acceptable (pause) under a limited-purpose licensed relationship classification (pause) with a valid authority chain (pause) and an endpoint presence statement. (pause) Queue position maintained. (pause) Processing window active.

choices.text: give: Operator-of-record identification and on-site statement
leave: Back

nodes.text: Operator-of-record: Field Systems Specialist. On-site.
Operator presence statement logged as a physical claim. (pause) Submission complete. Processing.
The console displays: “PROCESSING WINDOW ACTIVE.” The printer starts again, like it wants witnesses.

Standing: satisfied for limited-purpose licensed relationship. (pause) Service class: municipal legacy infrastructure. (pause) Action: SOL‑EARTH‑LOCAL reclassified into licensed relationship. (pause) Interconnection operational under new category.

Staple it to the front of the packet. (pause)
It proves the system signed off. (pause)
At least on paper.
